title: A pickup’s persistent plastic pan problems
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader's 2018 Ford F-150 has required three replacements of its plastic oil pan due to leaks.
Ford only covers the plastic oil pan under warranty; switching to a metal pan incurs extra labor costs.
The Car Doctor discusses design flaws in Ford and other manufacturers, affecting repair costs for common issues.

title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Kayshon Boutte, Rhamondre Stevenson, and Garrett Bradbury missed Wednesday's practice ahead of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers game.
Linebacker Christian Elliss did not practice due to a hip injury, further impacting Patriots' defensive readiness.
Tampa Bay's injury list includes Chris Godwin and Bucky Irving, limiting their participation before the Patriots matchup.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Bryan Mejia, 31, a baseball coach at Boston Athletic Academy, charged with felony fentanyl trafficking.
Mejia allegedly sold fentanyl to an undercover officer and is part of a larger trafficking organization.
He pled not guilty and was released on recognizance; next court appearance set for December 1.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group is closing its Boston, Detroit, and Cincinnati offices to transition to a fully remote workforce.
The company had moved its headquarters from Stamford, Conn. to Boston in 2014 and later to Seaport in 2019.
As of 2024, Cengage is incorporating generative AI solutions into its digital learning platforms for global users.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: 41 Patriots players worked out on their day off, impressing head coach Mike Vrabel.
Tuesday is the only NFL mandated off day, but a majority of the Patriots roster still trained.
The Patriots have a 7-2 record but focus remains on continued improvement, says Vrabel and player Stefon Diggs.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, were found dead in a home on Colonial Drive, Beverly.
Essex County District Attorney's Office identified the deaths as an apparent murder-suicide with gunshot wounds involved.
Beverly police, Massachusetts State Police, and the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner are investigating the incident.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis, 65, a South Boston man linked to James "Whitey" Bulger, was sentenced to 15 years for manslaughter.
Lewis pleaded guilty to manslaughter in the deaths of Brian Watson in 1984 and William Villani in 1993, resolving cold cases.
The plea deal came after first-degree murder charges were reduced, with both parties acknowledging trial risks, said Lewis' attorney.

title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Red Sox are reportedly interested in trading for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal this offseason.
Skubal, who won the 2024 AL Cy Young Award, could become a free agent after the 2026 season.
The Red Sox have the assets and financial capability to pursue Skubal, competing with teams like the Mariners and Mets.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge halted the installation of two patron saint statues at Quincy's new public safety building due to religious concerns.
PETA offers financial help for the statues if Quincy adds a statue of St. Francis of Assisi, the patron saint of animals.
The ACLU filed a lawsuit on behalf of 15 residents, resulting in a preliminary injunction against the statue installations.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praises QB Drake Maye for his strong performance, contributing to the Patriots' 7-2 record this season.
With 2,285 passing yards and 17 touchdowns, Maye is ranked fifth in the NFL and has top MVP odds.
Belichick warns about next season's challenges, highlighting the need for the Patriots to keep Maye healthy and avoid team regression.
